review_blob: A very well balanced beer.  Light aroma of sweet malt, toffee.  Taste is also slightly sweet, every so slightly fruity, crisply bitter.  A little smoke would make this first class!
beer_name: Devils Backbone Kilt Flasher Wee Heavy Scottish Ale

beer_brewer_name: Vermont Hard Cider Company, LLC (C&C; Group)
review_blob: Sweet and cloying with an artificial granny smith aroma...it actually smells pretty good but is overpowering.  I wonder if this has flavoring added?   Anyway, one-note, too sweet, not very interesting.

I prefer the dryer ciders but I still found this to be excellent...aroma is not strong but is apple, a little yeast, some astringent/dry note.  My bottle poured clear and straw-colored.  Taste is sweet, slightly tart but suffers in complexity, perhaps because of being just stayman?  Still a good refreshing cider.

beer_brewer_name: Vermont Hard Cider Company, LLC (C&C; Group)
review_blob: Aroma of sweet apple juice, pale gold appearance.  Taste is sweet apple juice, just a little oak and yeast, not complex and not very tart.  Body on the thin side ever for cider.  I was disappointed comparing this to all the other great craft cider in my area, but it is a tasty enough bev.

The bottle should mention: incredibly sweet.  I also thought the "light" spicing was actually rather heavy-handed.  Had a hard time finishing my (chilled) 8 oz glass of this. Just too sweet, not what I am personally looking for in a craft cider.  On the other had this made a KILLER addition to some pork gravy I was making....
beer_name: J.K.s Cuve Winterruption Farmhouse Hard Cider

review_blob: A delicious cider to be sure, but Id prefer it a bit dryer - it ends up tasting a little sweet & sour to me.  Im not sure but the sugars may be hiding a little of the earthiness of this cider, which is too bad.  Still, a super-drinkable cider at a very good price point.

I love the level of sweetness of this cider - quite dry.  I didnt find the "spice" very noticeable, thank goodness.  There are better craft ciders out there but usually at twice the price or more.  Wanderlust is well worth a try.

Very tart, some mineral, lightly sweet crisp and wonderful.  Far more in the American craft cider mode than the English or French.  Surprising complexity and a long finish off a single type of apple.  Best un-blended cider Ive had.  Bought a Wickson tree for the yard after tasting this!
beer_name: Wandering Aengus Ciderworks Wickson Single Varietal

review_blob: Complex blend of apples and their tannins. Wild but not really funky.  Very crisp.  Wonderful.  Wish I lived anywhere near WA.
beer_name: Tieton Cider Works Wild Washington Apple

review_blob: Wonderfully refreshing, tart and slightly sweet. A bit simpler than the Wild Washington.

From the brewery in Bend, mid-July.  Doesnt seem all that over-the-top to me.  Straightforward clean citrus op IPA.  Must be well-balanced if the IBUs are 100.  Best IPA/equivalent from Deschutes and a really good beer!

750ml from Market street wine shop.   Hazy pour. Aroma apple with slight yeast and funk.  Sweet and a little thin, though complex with sweet and tart apples and a little funk.  Complex but not as refreshing as Id hoped.
beer_name: Etienne Dupont Organic Cidre Bouch Brut de Normandie

review_blob: 750ml bottle.  Very tart & acidic.  Quite dry.  Bright and lively carbonation.  A little too tart to drink a lot of, but a single glass is excellent
The most unique of the Albemarle Ciderworks ciders.  Tart and slightly sweet, more apple-y than their others, with a very slightly spiciness as of apple skins.
Tasting as the cider room.  Lightly carbonated, bright, fresh, tart, crisp, and very slightly sweet.
UPDATED: JUL 19, 2010
Very disappointing, more like a sweet mead than an IPA.  Points for drinkability and a well-balanced body despite the high alcohol but the hops are completely overwhelmed by sweetness.

Many thanks to Beer Run for providing this one.  Tart and crisp with a big fluffy head.  Quite lemony.  Yellow & hazy in appearance.  Extremely refreshing. My only complaint was that it wasnt summer when I was drinking this.   I hope other raters will take style into consideration at least a little bit when rating this beer..its supposed to be this way!
For a strong ale, the alcohol was well-balanced  Despite the name, hops were not strong in the aroma, nor overwhelming to the taste.  Wanted this to be a DIPA, but it was good nonetheless.
solid pumpkin beer.  vanilla and spice as promised.  could bit a little stronger in the body but this is a very drinkable pumpkin ale

Ive had this on tap and in the bottle.  Keg was much better.  Love the juicy hops in the aroma and the taste.  A nice compromise on the ABV.  In fact, its quite perfect in this regard as the lower abv allows it to be less sweet.  I had no idea it was an "imperial" the first time I had it.
plum raisins and caramel, but without being too sweet, and showing up lots of spice as well.  splendid.
Potent chocolate aroma you can smell from across the table.  this beer is all chocolate all the time, but theres nothing wrong with that.  Alcohol nicely tucked away which is always a great thing!

Had an aged sample of this, I believe it was from 2007.  Unbelievably complex and delicious, each flavor passing over the palate in distinct succession.  Fruit, chocolate, licorice, coffee.  The alcohol is nicely tucked away in some sherry-like notes.  If youve got a bottle of this do yourself a favor and let it age !!
beer_name: Thirsty Dog Siberian Night Imperial Stout

review_blob: Ive had this on draft and from the can.  Great either way but the alcohol could be better hidden &#
Raisin caramel notes smoothed out over and into the darker flavors.  Sweet but not cloyingly so.  The elevated alcohol is invisible

Maybe its just my nose but most coffee stouts smell like stale coffee to me.  Anyway, it tasted far better than the smell but had an unpleasant alcohol bite coupled with some sweetness at around the 2/3rds mark.
On tap at Beer Run.  Less yeasty than most, very lemony citrus hops.  Light and crisp. Had no idea this was 7.5% untill looking here.  Delicious.

This is a terrific beer.  Crisp and tart without being too tart like some gueuze and also without the sticky sweetness of some sour ales.  Simple, clean, and utterly refreshing.  I dont understand the low ratings...are people expecting a pale ale when they drink this or something?

Ive had at least two bad bottles of this - who knows why - but finally got a good one.  Light, truly pale and bitter smooth. Not the pale ale Id expect from the makers of Two-hearted.  Solid, and not too hoppy, a good intro pale ale
On tap at the brewery, part of a sampler.  This was a refreshing break from the fairly mediocre beers in the sampler, the best of the bunch, a moderately hopped pale ale, light and crisp
beer_name: Grizzly Paw Bloody Hell Pale Ale

review_blob: On tap at the brewery, part of a sampler.  Not a very well balanced, too sweet with an almost raspberry-seed flavor at times
Sampler at the brewpub. Pretty good red here, nothing offensive though a tough sweet, with malt dominating (though its thin)
Deep brown, smells of sweet malt and sugar, raisins and a dark fruitiness in the middle then a nasty bite of alcohol (I think thats what it is) about 2/3rd of the way through ruins the finish.

On tap at the brewery, part of a sampler. Very bananay, which unfortunately in my book is not a positive, with a bit of spice afterwards.  I imagine that people who enjoy this style would like this one pretty well.
beer_name: Blue Mountain Rockfish Wheat Kristall Weizen

review_blob: On tap at the brewery, part of a sampler. Wasnt able to judge the head, but a smooth and delicious porter, roasty, chocolaty and with a nice lingering bitter finish.
On tap at the brewery, part of a sampler. Nothing too exciting but a decent lager, a step up compared to certain other local lagers I could name.
On tap at the brewery, part of a sampler. Not my style, but a crisp, clean, clear,  malty brew none the less.
Very solid pale ale and the best of their tasting sampler.  Would love to see a harvest version of this
beer_name: Blue Mountain Full Nelson Pale Ale

review_blob:
My roommates review:  faint yeast aroma, with something else in there, kinda grainy, hops are there but kinda faint, maybe grassy.  kinda bannany, kinda like bananas and grapefruit.  Bizarre fruit punch with the fruit you wouldnt usually put in punch flavor. 

I didnt like it that much either - too much alcohol coming through
was fairly unimpressed here, i didnt get much of the peat smoke some people have noticed.  A bit too sweet and generally ho-hum.  perhaps a bad bottle?
beer_name: Smuttynose Big Beer Series: Scotch Style Ale

review_blob: A bit thin, without much caramel/malt backbone, but I still thought this was a more than passable IPA
Solid pale ale, but i noticed some off-flavors similar to what i get when i dont let my home brews age long enough.  Not bad though!
dark brown head, quickly dissipating. aroma of sweet bourbon.  very nice on tap - didnt notice too much oak from the barrel
beer_name: Bluegrass Jeffersons Reserve Bourbon Barrel Stout

review_blob: Sweet aroma with a touch of yeast.   Taste, less yeasty (a good thing to me), some herbal notes, sweet but with a dry finish.  Served a bit too cold at a local bar, too bad
Very good IPA, not terribly over the top so good if you want something a little less bitter
obviously a very good pale ale, but leaves me wanting more...like their Celebration ale.
pours black with a medium brown head which quickly dissipated.  I liked the hint of anise or licorice, but didnt care for the alcohol poking through about 1/2 to 3/4 of the way in.
Best beer I ever had from a can.  Thin but nice banana and citrus. A tiny touch of yeast.  None of the esters that make some wits unpleasant
